piLfj9VHQniPGSOPVMNTRw.text: Impressed by deliciousness and creativity of their sushi! I think they are creating new style of sushi with full of  innovative ideas and respect to the Japanese tradition. Must try chef's special.

AxcZfxEHK6m4IhxhYAIMoQ.text: I have visited a few high end sushi places in London, but this place beats them all when it comes to the quality of sushi. The fish is tender, and fresh, the wasabi is home made and the rice is just perfect! The staff are friendly, and you can really tell when tasting the food that the chef is very passionate about sushi!

57UKIoaDx1yH9bfAhFyF1Q.text: One of the best sushis i ever had. Top. A bit pricey but amazingly fresh sushi and finally one place that gives u enough soy Sauce with your order!!!

DSJM9GanwBGGIAt4IUfBWg.text: What a lovely little place!I found this place via Yelp, but can't believe I haven't spotted it before as it's quite distinctive. All this time I've been nipping out to Abokado to get lunch when I could have been going here!The sushi is excellent. The staff are really nice, and it's really quiet, so handy for a quiet lunch with a friend or two.There's only very limited seating but they'll happily make you a fresh dish if you go in to sit down. Even the ready-made packs are freshly made that morning though.I will definitely be going here again, and taking colleagues too!

fCBOSC2mNBicMxAVp7JdNw.text: Best Sushi take out I have tried so far in London. It is affordable and better than any other big chains. The cut of the meat for their Nigiri selections are generous and unlike many other big chains, the fish are fresh and it does not smell at all. Highly recommended!

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Surprise - London, United Kingdom. Sushi equipments
Photo of Sushi Surprise - London, United Kingdom. Selection of sushi

SlKjO8Kdt3CLcDr_uFWN3Q.text: Fresh fish, friendly service and great 2for1 deal if coming late in the day. It very good for a take away joint, and you can ask for stuff to be made fresh for you.

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Surprise - London, United Kingdom. Thanks Yelp for our Nigiri surprise

GPNt778oPbPifasiEHx2bw.text: It's hard to come across good food in London. Portion sizes are small and the food can be a bit bland. My husband and I decided that we really wanted to try sushi in London. I went on Yelp and found this place, which had really good reviews. It was walking distance from the Landmark Apartments building we were staying at. I also noticed that we would get a free item when we checked in, so I was excited. We walked in and looked through the menu and then placed our order. I told the cashier that I just checked in on Yelp and confirmed that I would be getting a free item. She smiled and said yes. As they were making the sushi, we sat at a table. The place was nice, small and clean. About 20 minutes later we received our rolls. I believe we order 3 rolls. One being a dragon roll, shrimp tempura and the third one had salmon. Presentation was nice, but taste could've been way better. As I kept eating it, I started feeling nauseous. I had about 5 pieces and that was enough for me. They never gave us the free check in item, and I'm glad they didn't.

fmYoj9gcLnUHoIAc42n-NQ.text: I went here clearly expecting a slightly-better-than-Wasabi experience. Because I knew it was small, and they did stuff pre-packaged. But slightly better than Wasabi is still good right? So when we arrived, I saw it was tiny and that they told us there that we could select something out of the fridge. Or there was hot food. Or they had a few other things on the menu. For lunch, you can add Miso or a sushi surprise for £1 (£2 for both), but if you check in on your lovely Yelp app, the surprise is free. Ours turned out to be some blowtorched salmon and sun dried tomato nigiri sushi. And it was delicious.Because I'm insane and willing to spend a ridiculous amount of money on lunch, I opted for the sashimi platter. And some kimchi. Which isn't Japanese, but I love the stuff (plus vegetables, right?). The cashier warned me the kimchi was hot, but I didn't believe him. Because I like my hot food to blow my face off, and I knew it wasn't going to be that hot. (And it wasn't, but it was still spicy and delicious). My sashimi came out. It was FLIPPING GORGEOUS! Looked great on the plate and each piece came with something unusual. The tuna had some pickled wasabi on top. Yum. There were some crunchy bits and mayonnaise-y bits and other bits, and it was all delicious. (I even tried someone's gyoza. Also delicious.) Also some nice miso soup.It's a small venue (maybe 8 or 9 chairs in total), and even if you "eat in" and order from the menu, everything is served on throwaway plastic or paper crockery. So doesn't expect anything extravagant. What you can expect is some delicious sushi. Also don't expect a huge amount of variety. There isn't. But what there is is really good.

W4-P5OtG7xXY93ByU2EfpA.text: I am completely in love with Sushi Surprise, more than that, infatuated. I have been three times this week already. I officially have a sushi problem...This cute little sushi venue is about a 1 minute walk behind Itsu on Great Eastern Street. Why are you going to Itsu? Stop right now! Sushi Surprise has the fattest, freshest fish, lovingly prepared, and the rice is cooked to perfection, like little jewels of joy. Once you've tasted the quality and freshness on offer here you'll never want to go back to any of the chain sushi restaurants.The prices seem a little sporadic, but look closer and you'll see it's priced directly by the cost of the fish on offer. I regularly pick up the salmon/avocado rolls & nigiri lunch set for a VERY reasonable £4.90. Cheaper and bigger than Itsu, and SO much tastier. The tuna boxes are a little more, and then there are a bunch of specials to choose from which range from around £6 to £9.50. They look simply incredible.The chef clearly loves his job, and chats to me like a regular. I sometimes partake in one of his little cheeky 'surprises' and it always delights.Give it a try, it will change your mind about sushi forever.

UOuouidfaOlxuQAXVKxMjQ.text: Having heard a lot about this place I was very excited to try the sushi, and I was not disappointed! The flavours and combinations on offer were sublime - fresh, tangy tuna; silky salmon; delightful butterfish. The vegetarian nigiri were also great - I loved the combination of crunchy fresh peppers and creamy avocado in the ones I selected.

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Surprise - London, United Kingdom. Mmmmmmmmm.

eYHBR38cDqmpo-JBA5V4Yw.text: All your favourites are here. There was also a fantastic sweet and smoky glazed tuna sashimi. I will be back for more of that.

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Surprise - London, United Kingdom. Eating thus in nearby mark gardens. Delicious

fIADoMl0_DFWFt_dy4UbCA.text: Having developed a taste for the fresh seafood and authentic sushi from growing up in New Zealand, this was the one style of cuisine I found lacking by either quality or cost since arriving in London - until now."gourmet quality sushi at everyman prices"Sushi Surprise (over) delivers on promise.

SKayFpIUffqJuYcAhS91Ug.text: Outstanding sushi - very fresh, creative flavours and friendly staff. Get the dragon and rainbow rolls.

4tHgjXDrt9LJhdNAtRNMTw.text: This is an amazing quiet little lunch spot tucked away behind the busiest lunch streets in Shoreditch.  It's run by two friendly guys who are remember who you are and greet you with a smile, as well as checking what you do and don't eat before popping the 'surprise' into your takeaway. The best thing about Sushi Surprise for me though has to be the astounding standard of vegetarian sushi on offer. I'm used to being fobbed off with the usual avocado and cucumber affairs, but the veggie sushi box blew me away. The prices are slightly higher than I'd usually spend on lunch (more than a fiver) but I like to go at least once a week for a treat, as the meal packages are clearly prepared with real care and attention, and look beautiful as well as tasting fresh and delicious.

1pHFNcnjWXAI_Tm_a9kq9w.text: A surprise this was! Don't be fooled by its simple exterior and fridge case of what you think are just ordinary sushi boxes like you get in any cheap grocer. Nay. While the prices match these unexciting bland places, Sushi Surprise is not so! Firstly, I was excited by my free sushi surprise for checking in and within a moment, my mouth was just as excited! Ze master sushi chef handpicked a beautiful piece of salmon, drizzled teriyaki bbq sauce on it and then emblazened with a hand torch. Voila. A masterpiece in my mouth!Then, the very friendly lady at the cashier asked if I wanted the lunch special and when she realised I didn't know what that was and asked if this was my first time, I got the miso soup for free! First timers get free miso soup, folks!So I walked away with my takeout, already happy with this discovery and THEN! When I tasted the sushi is when the real magic happened. So much flavour! So much subtle addition! I got the salmon, california, and kim chee rolls for £4.50 and each one of these was incredible and better than anything I've ever gotten in a box. Like Pamela said, I almost felt guilty about adding soy sauce to the rolls as it may obscure some of these flavours and not do it justice! (and I looove soy sauce too!) Can't wait to try all their other sushi and be treated to more surprises!

NDFBnnbxkazJjsIcA-467Q.text: One of the best value for money sushi delivery places I have came across lately. So I am definitely marking it down as my go-to place when I am having craving for sushi, mind you that happens quite often! So I could not rate them with five starts, because you can only choose between delivery and takeaway! But again that makes it quite affordable because sushi in London does not come cheap! The sushi rolls are fresh and tasty, and the fish - salmon and tuna I tried, were veryyy yummyyy! Ordering online is very simple even for me and they have a special surprise sushi! Yay!

LjkmXPXEWoNc0m59SxI2gw.text: Marvelous place. Just what I look for in a lovely restaurant. Great service, resonably priced food and fantastic quality! Amazing place. Probably the best sushi right now in london in the lower price tier.

LqPjU_yu5SKyvptVObGjPw.text: The sushi was incredible. I have been meaning to visit a decent sushi bar in Shoreditch and a local promotion gave me the kick I needed to visit this one. The sushi was fresh and prepared right infront of me, it tasted great and the staff are friendly too. Looks like I've found my local sushi bar.

_PmK1dtgrL0-d8Sa_yhGIw.text: Delightful little shop tucked away in a small Shoreditch street.  Compared to the high end stuff, they are right on par with quality but at a tremendous value.  I went for lunch the other day and really enjoyed the lunchbox.  But to my surprise, they offer free miso soup and a chef surprise, which is mostly why I am giving them 5 stars - the surprise is a great teaser to whatever food you're taking away.  Plus, their staff is very friendly and willing to explain their menu for newbies.  Definitely will go back and right now, they're my spot for sushi in my neighborhood.

qZPIS3gI8IZjsheWjHJDpQ.text: Sushi was cheap but not that great. I had the spider roll, and wasn't impressed by the flavor. When I requested chipotle mayo, the server actually told me it would make my roll taste bad, but it definitely needed sauce to amplify it. The surprise was one piece of barbecue salmon. It was very sweet, but I preferred it over my spider roll.

wIXPMyswP0Zggmp7_E9GLA.text: The best takeaway sushi ever! Only just discovered this place last night through a friend. It's a shame about the location as it was difficult finding the place. Sushi is presented well and tastes so good. I ordered a salmon and avocado roll (8 pieces) and 2 pieces of prawn nigiri (you can select a special topping). Tasted soo good. I will definitely go again.

k5hSXfvapNVE9LSo_6pjeQ.text: Thanks for the free sushi it was absolutely delicious.  I'll definitely be coming back for lunch some time!

VX9pZh88Lf2tITOaPE79Rw.text: My fiance and I were on vacation in London and we were craving sushi.  We stumbled across this place and were not disappointed. We kept our order simple with a spicy tuna roll and a spicy salmon roll. It was quick and delicious...exactly what we needed!

9bz8PxSYOgfmHufqLKvaNw.text: Excellent little joint. Great service, good food. My only gripe was the weird white sauce in the salmon avo roll, we don't do that in the US, it's not necessary.

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Surprise - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Sushi Surprise - London, United Kingdom

h0qVuAhJwEE7ASzMXrjUqA.text: I have been there few times and I love this place for a quick sushi fix! It's very affordable, especially if you come in the evening. The pre made boxes will be 25% off.Normally the staff is very welcoming. For a strange reason last time I went they were not as nice as usual. Maybe because we were Friday evening ...For the sushi the combination are quite unexpected. I love the fact that they twisted the regular salmon roll with a bit a yuzu it ads a lovely freshness to the maki.

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Surprise - London, United Kingdom

kAvQgNsfKi0722AyBilcHA.text: I'm writing this review about a month late, but I came here while visiting London. I would say the sushi is pretty alright and definitely exceeds the expectations for what a to-go sushi spot would be like. I had the salmon avocado roll, which wasn't too bad. The fish was pretty fresh (from what I could taste), so that's always great. I really enjoyed the "Surprise" with check-in which for me was the seared salmon roll if I remember correctly. I would definitely recommend this to those looking to grab a quick bite and is not too picky about quality - it's good though, just not spectacular.

QgCNl4tC6hkNaQH7JsZTvQ.text: We had a wonderful experience at Sushi Surprise.My wife and I were in town and craving Sushi and decided on SS largely from the great Yelp reviews and it did not disappoint.I have a high standard when it comes to sushi quality and this place exceeded expectations.Since they are mostly geared for take away and delivery, do not expect much in terms of a store front, but the quality and and price can't be matched near downtown.We spoke with the manager Ken who described how the fish is brought in daily at 6 AM to insure freshness which is demonstrated from the results!Highly recommend. Try the barbecue salmon nigiri / sashimi. It's lightly cooked with a blow torch so you must eat it quickly, but out of this world.Thanks Ken & sushi chefs for the wonderful experience.

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Surprise - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Sushi Surprise - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Sushi Surprise - London, United Kingdom

g8amC5mEEnUT4hk37g5B0Q.text: There certainly nothing wrong with this quick sushi spot and perhaps the great reviews created too high of an expectation for me, but I found this place to be close to satisfactory than exceptional. In fairness, I'd probably give it 3.5 stars if that were an option. I only went once so perhaps they had an off night and I should try it again, but my first impression is just decent not excellent.

1q_ot-0CgpGZVJ9wXjgeCQ.text: Indeed this place was a surprise! Finally, I've found good sushi in London!There are very few places that I would recommend for sushi in London and this is one of them. Usually it's a mound of rice, badly rolled with soft fillings... however not here! They had a lovely fresh selection which was beautifully, artistically made, stuffed with fresh, crunchy and fillings and topped with yummy fresh fish.I absolutely love that they have the fridge stockers, but will make you hot food (including Gyoza) and other fresher items to order. I couldn't help but drool at the cut fish and imagine what these offerings would taste like. Why is this place not closer to me for lunch?As it was close to closing time, we opted for the premium roll selection (around £12 eat in) from the fridge, and have to say that the veggie special roll was my favourite - so fresh and crispy! However the dragon roll and rainbow roll were also fantastic. Melting in the mouth and so flavourful. A good tip is that they offer these 2 for 1 at the end of the day (great if you're happy to hedge your bets and have an early dinner)... Also being lucky enough to check in with the Yelp #YelptoberFeast we received a free salmon nigiri selection, which was absolutely delicious. It came beautifully seared and presented. I could easily have finished off a stack of those! I hope they start offering them as standard (the're not on the menu).The staff were also very friendly and informative, and I left bulging at the seams.A great place, with real fast food at its best... especially with take away an option. I really recommend you check these guys out, they are well worth going off the beaten track for.

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Surprise - London, United Kingdom

vzqSYmAkrl8SbC-sJ59jJA.text: Sushi Surprise is probably the best value sushi place in London.I came here a couple of weeks ago on a UYE (unofficial yelp event). I'd heard really good things about this place, so joined a small group of yelpers to try it out. The chefs here have been trained at high end London Sushi restaurants like Yashin and The Arts Club.I's a very small place with a limited amount of high stool tables. I think most of the lunchtime trade is local workers, who take the boxes away and eat back at their workplace.They have a great lunchtime offer, where you order a main and get miso soup for an additional £1, or a surprise for £1 . You can have both for an additiona £1.80. The great thing is, that if you check in with the Yelp app, you get the surprise free. For the surprise included flame seared sushi, where the chef prepared in front of us. The spicy tuna rolls were really tastey. I loved them.They also offer a hot selection, which changes, so you need to ask them or check online to find out what the hot dish of the day is.It's hard the believe that this is an independent establishment, as it has the feel of being part of a chain. In fact the place is so good, I've a feeling that is the first of many Sushi Surprises that will be sprining up over London. Highly recommend Sushi Suprise. It was even worth dragging my limbs from the other side of London to try it out. I will be back!!

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Surprise - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Sushi Surprise - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Sushi Surprise - London, United Kingdom

i3iqifUQhcE83oxnvA8PWg.text: Totally awesome sushi. The man was really helpful explaining the different varieties and the no of pieces. I ordered the roll selection and the spicy salmon roll. Both were fantastic. The spicy salmon was my favourite- it had that extra kick to it. The miso soup was nice - I don't usually like it but this is the first time I've actually drank it. Minimum delivery order is £10 hence ordering the soup. But glad I did now. Fab place will definitely put this on my short list.

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Surprise - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Sushi Surprise - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Sushi Surprise - London, United Kingdom

5Lyts-L9-4p_LEQsl7KcJg.text: Why has it taken me so long to find out about this place??!! Located about 5 minutes from Liverpool Street I'm seriously tempted to have lunch here every day.I've tried a couple of different things now and I can't fault a single one. From the free Miso soup on my first visit, 2 different chef's surprises (check in on the Yelp app or pay £1) to the salmon and avocado rolls everything has been absolutely delicious. The highlight for me though was the tuna selection. 8 spicy tuna rolls and 3 tuna nigri for less than £9. An absolute steal. They have all of the fresh fish in the counter for the sashimi and this is what I'll be trying next as I doubt I will get better for an affordable price. I can't recommend Sushi Surprise enough and I'll even go as far as to say that this is the best I've had in London. See you there!

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Surprise - London, United Kingdom. Lunch

xcptgqncCWif7PJvid7QPw.text: Unfortunately I managed to pop into Sushi Surprise when they were about to close but the manager was happy to sort me out.  I think I had a 12 piece premium roll selection with king prawn, crab stick and asparagus.  It tasted really good.  The king prawn roll was my favourite, the crab was good too, but I'm not a huge fan of asparagus so didn't like it that much.  However I would be very happy to munch on the prawn and crab rolls all day every day.  The best thing about the sushi is that they tasted good, were fresh and you could tell they were made with care as Sushi Surprise have they're own individual style in presenting their food, which makes them stand out from the rest. The staff are friendly, it's small venue but I like the look of it and there's a couple of tables and stools if you want to eat in. I'll definitely be back to try some more.

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Surprise - London, United Kingdom. Tasted great!

IMmYjW3FnOPJK2ymGL2A_w.text: Delightful fresh sushi takeaway, just two small tables for sit-in. Salmon and fish is v fresh, smooth and firm texture. Spider roll average. Surprise premium bbq salmon nigiri excellent. First timers get free miso soup. Near closing time, buy one get one free deal available. Great value for fresh sushi!

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Surprise - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Sushi Surprise - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Sushi Surprise - London, United Kingdom

7h2e8R9QPvaMixPyIxhqRQ.text: The best sushi We had in a very long time!!! When we entered the shop we were a bit surprised cause it was super tiny and in some side street of shoreditch.. but the welcoming staff made us feel home right away :) Great prices! Very fresh and excellent customer service!! They explained the sushi when it was brought to the table ( super nicely decorated) and even suggested to eat it with a certain soya sauce specifically chosen for this type of sushi!!! Sushi tasted amazingly flavourful!! Customer service you would only expect to find in some Michelin star restaurant!!! I wish they would be more recognised for the amazing service and excellent food!! Please alwas tip them as they don't even do the usual 10% service charge because they are too nice!!! Still amazed by this amazing food we had and will definitely go there again!!We paid 40 pounds for 2 people and we had a LOT of sushi!!

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Surprise - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Sushi Surprise - London, United Kingdom

RmTgEJSDlHSy-5U0O2kduA.text: Oooh so again if you hadn't figured this out yet I am new to working in the city. Having popped in here for the Yelp festival offer a few weeks ago I have now become a regular visit to this little gem.From their delicious dumplings to their marvellous maki what really makes this place stand out is their daily sushi surprise. Always unique....always tasty. The surprise often pulls in flavours you wouldn't associate with suishi but never disappoints. favourite so far involved some seared tuna and truffle...I mean truffle is always a good thing by in their capable hands it was a triumph.So if you're in the city and looking for an alternative sushi surprise I highly recommend you pop on by

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Surprise - London, United Kingdom. #sushisurprise yuuuuum

9JvKNBlJL6rKDHY4CMmRmg.text: Ok, I'm only giving Sushi Surprise a 4-star for the sheer fact that it's not the high high end of sushi/sashimi, however, for the price and the quick output this place is pretty damn solid. I hit them up the other day for a one-person dinner on the way home to get a quick sushi fix. You order online, the process is insanely simple. You just select the rolls you would like, add them to your basket, and can even opt in for a special surprise. Delivery or takeaway, your choice.A good number of options in meat type, salmon, whitefish, tuna, veggie options as well. I'll say the name is not optimal because who really wants their sushi to be a surprise right? We want to know that it's safe considering the raw and fish aspect. But once you get it it's great. I'd highly recommend this to anyone looking for a solid sushi experience when time and cost are a factor. Additionally, it's great for team lunches, easy to order and they offer delivery. We just ordered for a team planning meeting. Everything was on time, ready to go, not one mistake in the whole thing. We fed seven, kept it under £100 and the group was full at the end. Plus there's hot options as well, including edamame, miso + apps like Gyoza. Yeah, I'm a fan.

1Dd7nityfOCLHuNxCR-Zlw.text: Tucked away In the heart of Shoreditch is this little sushi joint @sushisurpriseuk a nice special array of nigiri here with some elements like bbq or avocado on top that was created specially for #yelptoberfestThe fish was fresh and well put together with care. Will be back to visit and try more if in area.

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Surprise - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Sushi Surprise - London, United Kingdom. Special nigiri selection
Photo of Sushi Surprise - London, United Kingdom. Searing the salmon nigiri

NjmWBR6puEVrixO4ebgdVA.text: Might be because I grew up in Cali around fresh sushi down city streets right and left. Maybe it's because I agreed to the buy one, get one free special off the shelf.The sushi was surprisingly not great here... The rolls were equivalent to the cold, hard square ones we'd have at grocery stores back at home. My hubby (who is from here) and I were both disappointed though.This is a small, fast-food type location where the rolls are...well...small as well. Is it just us, or are they lacking in flavor? I'm confused; this seems to be a common style of sushi rolls around here, spanning from Birmingham to London. Sleek fillets of fish wrapped in seaweed and it's sushi time! ..Er, is this how England likes their sushi? We're paying for quality-grade *raw* fish, which is a unique culture and art form to be deliciously appreciated. There should be more than a sliver, and a combination of flavors that compliment it's unique succulent bites.

519fcShEvjdvw5mggb7U1A.text: I kind of didn't really want to like this place because it's not very authentic but the sushi is just so darn good, especially for its price point.The venue itself isn't much to look at, and walking in near closing time all the takeaway boxes were already gone.The chef was happy to accommodate me though and my order was made fresh in front of me. I was also given a free bbq salmon sushi to whet my appetite while I waited thanks to Yelp's check in offer. One tube ride and half an hour later I was sat at home with my new style sushi box. Each sushi had its own mini dressing and the perfect fish to rice ratio. The side salad that came with the sushi was surprisingly varied too and also came with its own dressing. 8 pieces was definitely not enough though and it left me empty and wanting more. I'll be back sushi surprise!

lfowiOt9W9RHxQxAsrN9uw.text: I had two boxes... Because, well... SUSHI! I got the special roll selection (crab, salmon and herring rolls) along with some Miso and WOW was that amazing!The rice was a perfect measure of soft and sticky, holding together amazingly when held with the chopsticks.All of the fish was amazingly fresh and gorgeously glazed. I normally LOVE soy sauce on my sushi but this was so perfect it didn't need anything else.It gets a little busy at lunch time, but thats just a testament to how amazing it is. If you're in the area you HAVE to go in here!This place really is as good as it gets!

QOxKL9xmXD3I-s0GDFeY8Q.text: I brought two friends here and wow, what amazing sushi! I got the tuna set, miso soup, and the salmon set. My favourite is definitely the salmon. The guy behind the counter took his sweet time to grill the salmon with a flame gun, which was awesome to watch in a small takeaway place like this. Ideal place for lunch if you work around here :)

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Surprise - London, United Kingdom

vdNciH1s1S8z2CTVqs6LUw.text: Sushi Surprise is serving Michelin quality Sushi at shockingly fair prices.  Do yourself a favor - sit at the table in front of the chef.  He is a master of his craft, and extremely nice, and watch him work his magic.

photos.caption: Photo of Sushi Surprise - London, United Kingdom
Photo of Sushi Surprise - London, United Kingdom. Special bday sushi
Photo of Sushi Surprise - London, United Kingdom
